Who are we?
Michigan Milk Producers Association (MMPA), established in 1916, is a member owned and operated dairy cooperative. MMPA serves approximately 1,600 dairy farmer members in Michigan, Indiana, Wisconsin and Ohio. The dairy cooperative, the 10th largest in the U.S., employs approximately 320 people in four states.
MMPA markets nearly 5 billion pounds of milk annually to fluid milk customers and food ingredient manufacturers. MMPA operates two manufacturing plants in Ovid and Constantine, Michigan and a cheese plant in Middlebury, Indiana. Products made at the Michigan plants include butter, ultra-filtered milk, powdered milk, cream and condensed skim milk. These products are sold to a wide range of food manufacturers who make end-use products such as candy, ice cream, pudding, baked goods, cheese and yogurt.

Responsibilities

About OpsTech IT
Operations is at the heart of Amazon business. We are known for our speed, accuracy, and exceptional service. Our buildings deliver tens of thousands of products to hundreds of countries worldwide, every day. OpsTech IT is a global organization who provides 24x7 IT support to Amazon Operations, including Fulfillment, Sortation, Logistics, and Last Mile. We also provide operational support on behalf of key partners including Amazon Fulfillment Technologies, OpsTech Infrastructure Engineering, Amazon Robotics, Amazon Warehouse Control Systems, and Amazon Lockers.

Together, we take ownership for what we do — whether supporting IT infrastructure, developing new technology in-house, launching a new Amazon Fulfillment Center, or delighting our customers by delivering packages directly to them. When we hire you at Amazon, we hire for the future. With unlimited career opportunities, Amazon invests in ensuring our teams are consistently inspired, constantly learning from each other, and are creatively contributing to our next big idea. You will be surrounded by the best innovators of our time. We value diversity! See why diversity is important to us at amazon.com/diversity

We are looking for self-motivated individuals to take on new challenges and motivate teams in fostering solutions to the hurdles we face. Your role as a leader will be to confront obstacles others avoid and create a team that embodies our leadership principles.

About The Role
You will be leading a team of IT professionals with various skill sets on our OpsTech IT Service Desk to provide truly innovative technical support to Amazon’s Operations team who fulfill our customer promises millions of times a day. The technology varies between our different facilities, but Amazon’s core IT infrastructure is fully redundant and relies upon top tier vendor hardware networked over fiber optic, copper, and wireless topologies. Your internal customers, whether human, robotic, or mechanical, use mobile computing devices, thin clients, integrated computer, and PCs running Windows, Linux, and Android operating systems to virtually and physically move e-commerce items from our suppliers into our fulfillment centers shelves, from those shelves into packaging, those packages into cars, trucks, and airplanes for delivery to front doors around the world.

Who are we?
Michigan Milk Producers Association (MMPA), established in 1916, is a member owned and operated dairy cooperative. MMPA serves approximately 1,600 dairy farmer members in Michigan, Indiana, Wisconsin and Ohio. The dairy cooperative, the 10th largest in the U.S., employs approximately 320 people in four states.
MMPA markets nearly 5 billion pounds of milk annually to fluid milk customers and food ingredient manufacturers. MMPA operates two manufacturing plants in Ovid and Constantine, Michigan and a cheese plant in Middlebury, Indiana. Products made at the Michigan plants include butter, ultra-filtered milk, powdered milk, cream and condensed skim milk. These products are sold to a wide range of food manufacturers who make end-use products such as candy, ice cream, pudding, baked goods, cheese and yogurt.

THE ROLE

As Dispatch’s IT Manager, you will optimize information technology systems and provide technical and operational support to Dispatch employees. You will work with senior leaders to set the company’s IT strategy, including identifying new systems, tools, and services to meet the needs of our growing business. Nestlé Purina is expanding once again! Our newest facility in Eden, North Carolina is set to open in 2022. Revitalized from a former brewery, our plant will use modern production capabilities to meet increasing demand for dry pet food. This growing demand will help establish more than an estimated 300 jobs by 2024, made possible by Nestlé Purina’s $450 million investment. Designed with sustainability and safety front of mind, this facility will play a pivotal role in our global environment commitment of Zero Waste for Disposal, Caring for Water, 100 percent renewable electricity use and zero net greenhouse gas emissions by 2050. We’re thrilled to call Eden, North Carolina home to our 22nd factory in the U.S. and looking forward to serving pets and the people who love them!

As an Assistant IT Manager, you will join the heartbeat of our business and become part of the critical processes that allow us to delight our customers and consumers around the world. Your primary responsibility will be to assist in the overall management of Information Technology and associated hardware at the factory level with emphasis placed on maintaining systems that support the business strategies of the manufacturing/distribution environment.

The best of managerial professionals think ahead of our needs. You’re proactive—constantly lending a hand to what we need before we need it. You know all the ins and outs—many of the details most of us will never know. Nestlé Purina is a place where you’ll surround yourself with teams and projects that are making history in pet care. We’re leaning on you for those details that make an immeasurable difference in every area of what we do.

PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES

Supervise activities of Information Technology personnel
Ensure factory infrastructure and data administration practices are in alignment with company policies and best practices
Collaborate and consult with factory departments to maintain technology
Lead factory applications development efforts and direct specific IT projects
Assist in department budgeting (purchasing, maintenance and reporting)
Participate in the development and management of three-year department Capital Program
Coordinate the administration of factory Information Technology & Systems Planning
Coordinate the maintenance of the Disaster Recovery Plan
Assume all other duties as assigned by the Regional Information Technology Manager

Qualifications


Bachelor’s Degree in Management of Information Systems, Computer Science, Business Administration or related field
2+ years of IT experience in a manufacturing, industrial, military, or related environment

An amazing hospital in Coastal Oregon is seeking a Hospital Information Technology IT Director to become an influential leader in for both their Hospital and affiliated clinics.

The Hospital Information Technology IT Director will act as a liaison between the Hospital, Clinics, Clinical Departments and the IT Department. The Hospital Informatics Director will implement and lead projects for employee evaluation, selection and the clinical systems, including: EHR, PACS, and digital imaging. Through this, the Informatics Director IT will determine the needs and requirements for clinical applications in both acute care and ambulatory healthcare settings.

Under the supervision of the Hospital CMO, the Hospital Information Technology IT Director will work with staff from all departments, as well as physicians, by educating and training each individual on the clinical systems. Through this, the IT Clinical Informatics Director will help optimize the highest quality outcome to help meet the organizational goals. In addition to helping train clinical and medical staff, the Hospital Information Technology Specialist will consistently update policy and procedures pertaining to use of clinical information systems, utilizing feedback from staff and managers. They will also work closely with all IT Department staff, as well as, Revenue Cycle department staff.

The Hospital Information Technology IT Director will possess at least a bachelor’s degree in information technology, while a masters is preferred. Furthermore, the Healthcare IT Director will have at least 8 years in an IT role, 5 years in a leadership titled role in information technology, as well as information technology experience in a healthcare setting.

Living in Coastal Oregon, the Hospital Information Technology IT Director will have the chance to hike, fish, hunt or camp on a regular basis as this is an outdoorsman’s paradise. Furthermore the Healthcare Director of Information Technology will have the chance to live in one of Oregon’s most affordable places.

The Hospital Information Technology IT Director will work where their experience and prestige are truly valued! This hospital is dedicated to being the best in healthcare and wants to reflect this by taking care of their employees. They are prepared to offer the IT Director a rewarding compensation package and full family medical/dental coverage.

Who are we?
Michigan Milk Producers Association (MMPA), established in 1916, is a member owned and operated dairy cooperative. MMPA serves approximately 1,600 dairy farmer members in Michigan, Indiana, Wisconsin and Ohio. The dairy cooperative, the 10th largest in the U.S., employs approximately 320 people in four states.
MMPA markets nearly 5 billion pounds of milk annually to fluid milk customers and food ingredient manufacturers. MMPA operates two manufacturing plants in Ovid and Constantine, Michigan and a cheese plant in Middlebury, Indiana. Products made at the Michigan plants include butter, ultra-filtered milk, powdered milk, cream and condensed skim milk. These products are sold to a wide range of food manufacturers who make end-use products such as candy, ice cream, pudding, baked goods, cheese and yogurt.

About OpsTech IT
Operations is at the heart of Amazon business. We are known for our speed, accuracy, and exceptional service. Our buildings deliver tens of thousands of products to hundreds of countries worldwide, every day. OpsTech IT is a global organization who provides 24x7 IT support to Amazon Operations, including Fulfillment, Sortation, Logistics, and Last Mile. We also provide operational support on behalf of key partners including Amazon Fulfillment Technologies, OpsTech Infrastructure Engineering, Amazon Robotics, Amazon Warehouse Control Systems, and Amazon Lockers.

Together, we take ownership for what we do — whether supporting IT infrastructure, developing new technology in-house, launching a new Amazon Fulfillment Center, or delighting our customers by delivering packages directly to them. When we hire you at Amazon, we hire for the future. With unlimited career opportunities, Amazon invests in ensuring our teams are consistently inspired, constantly learning from each other, and are creatively contributing to our next big idea. You will be surrounded by the best innovators of our time. We value diversity! See why diversity is important to us at amazon.com/diversity

We are looking for self-motivated individuals to take on new challenges and motivate teams in fostering solutions to the hurdles we face. Your role as a leader will be to confront obstacles others avoid and create a team that embodies our leadership principles.

About The Role
You will be leading a team of IT professionals with various skill sets on our OpsTech IT Service Desk to provide truly innovative technical support to Amazon’s Operations team who fulfill our customer promises millions of times a day. The technology varies between our different facilities, but Amazon’s core IT infrastructure is fully redundant and relies upon top tier vendor hardware networked over fiber optic, copper, and wireless topologies. Your internal customers, whether human, robotic, or mechanical, use mobile computing devices, thin clients, integrated computer, and PCs running Windows, Linux, and Android operating systems to virtually and physically move e-commerce items from our suppliers into our fulfillment centers shelves, from those shelves into packaging, those packages into cars, trucks, and airplanes for delivery to front doors around the world.

We are committed to developing a diverse organization and we are even more committed to working with you to make that happen. Amazon offers competitive compensation packages, including comprehensive healthcare benefits starting on Day 1 and up to 20 weeks of paid parental leave. If you’re not in it for those perks, here is one more: we don’t wear suits and ties! Come as you are because jeans, t-shirts, sneakers and sometimes a neon safety vest will be your daily outfit. Jeff Bezos’s most recent letter to shareholders sums it all up pretty well. Find it at https://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/1018724/000119312516530910/d168744dex991.htm

Nestlé Purina is expanding once again! Our newest facility in Eden, North Carolina is set to open in 2022. Revitalized from a former brewery, our plant will use modern production capabilities to meet increasing demand for dry pet food. This growing demand will help establish more than an estimated 300 jobs by 2024, made possible by Nestlé Purina’s $450 million investment. Designed with sustainability and safety front of mind, this facility will play a pivotal role in our global environment commitment of Zero Waste for Disposal, Caring for Water, 100 percent renewable electricity use and zero net greenhouse gas emissions by 2050. We’re thrilled to call Eden, North Carolina home to our 22nd factory in the U.S. and looking forward to serving pets and the people who love them!

As an Assistant IT Manager, you will join the heartbeat of our business and become part of the critical processes that allow us to delight our customers and consumers around the world. Your primary responsibility will be to assist in the overall management of Information Technology and associated hardware at the factory level with emphasis placed on maintaining systems that support the business strategies of the manufacturing/distribution environment.

The best of managerial professionals think ahead of our needs. You’re proactive—constantly lending a hand to what we need before we need it. You know all the ins and outs—many of the details most of us will never know. Nestlé Purina is a place where you’ll surround yourself with teams and projects that are making history in pet care. We’re leaning on you for those details that make an immeasurable difference in every area of what we do.

PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES

Supervise activities of Information Technology personnel
Ensure factory infrastructure and data administration practices are in alignment with company policies and best practices
Collaborate and consult with factory departments to maintain technology
Lead factory applications development efforts and direct specific IT projects
Assist in department budgeting (purchasing, maintenance and reporting)
Participate in the development and management of three-year department Capital Program
Coordinate the administration of factory Information Technology & Systems Planning
Coordinate the maintenance of the Disaster Recovery Plan
Assume all other duties as assigned by the Regional Information Technology Manager

Qualifications


Bachelor’s Degree in Management of Information Systems, Computer Science, Business Administration or related field
2+ years of IT experience in a manufacturing, industrial, military, or related environment

The Role at a Glance

Who are we?
Michigan Milk Producers Association (MMPA), established in 1916, is a member owned and operated dairy cooperative. MMPA serves approximately 1,600 dairy farmer members in Michigan, Indiana, Wisconsin and Ohio. The dairy cooperative, the 10th largest in the U.S., employs approximately 320 people in four states.
MMPA markets nearly 5 billion pounds of milk annually to fluid milk customers and food ingredient manufacturers. MMPA operates two manufacturing plants in Ovid and Constantine, Michigan and a cheese plant in Middlebury, Indiana. Products made at the Michigan plants include butter, ultra-filtered milk, powdered milk, cream and condensed skim milk. These products are sold to a wide range of food manufacturers who make end-use products such as candy, ice cream, pudding, baked goods, cheese and yogurt.

The Opportunity:
The responsibilities of an IT Manager’s vary based on a company’s needs, but typically focuses on computer networks. IT Managers determine new hardware and software needs, oversee code requirements and run cables to new work areas. The IT Manager runs tests to verify that the components of the system are functioning at maximum efficiency.

Inclusa’s Information Technology Division has completely transformed – we’ve moved over 80% of our assets to the cloud and have modernized our entire end user compute environment. Our customer satisfaction scores are through the roof, we have an amazing partnership with the business, and we’re leading the Company’s digital transformation.
We’re seeking a highly motivated leader to join our team as the IT Service Desk Manager. In this highly visible leadership role, you will be responsible for leading the optimization of our IT Service Desk using ITIL principles to drive process, process automation, problem identification/resolution and more. We’ve done an amazing job supporting our colleagues, but we know we have a lot of opportunity to leverage best practices, innovation, artificial intelligence, automation, data and more to optimize our operations and shifting resources from break-fix to value driving activities.
It doesn’t stop there, in order to truly ensure we deliver an amazing experience you will also be responsible for further modernizing our Windows 10 Enterprise desktop computing environment utilizing Microsoft Intune and Windows Autopilot to provide a world class, modern, secure, stable computing environment that enables our colleagues to achieve their outcomes from their very first day on the team.

Provide recommendations for long-term corporate Information Technology (IT) requirements and short-term tactical plan. Assess new computing technologies and the feasibility of system enhancements to determine potential value.

Provides overall expertise with all network operations functions.
Ability to define, implement and enforce configuration management and change management policies and practices.

Job Title: IT Service Manager (ITSM) with App Port Mgt (APM)
Job Description:
Founded on the principles of trust, experience, and innovation, Trexin Consulting specializes in strategy execution – the implementation of business strategy to achieve targeted business goals. Applied strategy situations that Trexin frequently leads include: digital transformations for business, scaling capabilities for growth, optimizing operations for cost reduction, driving synergies for M&A and recovering projects in distress. Trexin’s services are right-sized for our Clients’ needs, ranging from our “Diamond Team” service when our Clients want Trexin to own an outcome and share the delivery risk, to Expert/Advisory services for senior-level guidance, to Strategic Staffing services for execution-oriented tasks and roles. Our expertise spans Healthcare, Life Sciences, Financial Services, and Products & Distribution, overlaid by multidisciplinary skills in the four capabilities essential to strategy execution: Strategy & Innovation, Program Execution, Technology, and Analytics.
Trexin Consulting is currently seeking an IT Service Management (ITSM) Manager to join our team and consult at our Financial Services clients.

IT Support & Infrastructure Manager
New Holland, PA
The IT Support & Infrastructure Manager will oversee and manage the Information Technology Support Team to deliver excellent and reliable IT Support and Infrastructure Systems throughout Superior Plastic Products & Affiliates. This person will be a crucial member of the IT Leadership Team representing & leading the IT Support & Infrastructure function. Also, this position must relentlessly focus on developing our Information Technology Support function as a Center of Excellence. Able to keep IT Infrastructure & Systems one step ahead of company growth goals & objectives and think & communicate strategically with your team & Company Leadership.
Provide leadership, management & accountability for IT Support & Infrastructure Team members.

The Information Technology Manager will focus on enterprise applications, infrastructure applications and IT governance. This position will manage the day to day functions of all corporate software. This includes core banking, business and infrastructure applications, during their entire lifecycle. The position will work with assigned business units to evaluate technology process improvements and solutions. This position will also manage the software portfolio and lifecycle. This manager will provide day to day oversight of the IT governance function.
Job Requirements:
Bachelor’s degree in MIS, Information Technology, or Computer Science related field.
Experience managing technology teams, with a focus on development and performance management.
Experience managing technology, banking or governance projects.

Responsible for overseeing multiple simultaneous IT audit projects, including providing initial approval of audit scope, risk control matrices, audit programs, workpaper documentation, and summary reports of audit findings; including mentoring and training staff.
Assist Senior Managers and Audit Directors in the identification and monitoring of strategic emerging risks to aid in the development of the quarterly audit plan.
Assist Senior Managers and Audit Directors in the identification and development of department strategic priorities, promoting enhancements and/or new/innovative solutions to audit department governance/structure and/or processes.
Assist Senior Managers and Audit Directors in the recruiting, hiring and development of Audit staff.
Manages and prioritizes limited resources across complex and highly visible multidisciplinary activities or projects to maximize efficiency, ensuring staff are given opportunities to develop needed skills and are provided timely feedback on performance.
Approves testing and related results, ensuring testing objectives are achieved and conclusions reached are adequately supported, summarizing written findings to be considered for reporting.
Validates team/project assignments are completed within time schedules while also meeting quality requirements, limiting any potential delays.
Reviews formal written draft reports and works with audit teams to recommend proper rating and prioritization of audit observations and inclusion of value-added recommendations; works with business owners to enhance and finalize the report.
Interprets and applies IT (including general computer, application and information security controls), industry, accounting, regulatory and internal audit standards.
Possesses a solution-oriented approach and a sense of commitment and influence to getting results and ensuring project assignments are completed.
Participates in identifying process improvements and supports the implementation of departmental changes.
Communicates and presents information to customers, colleagues, and senior Audit & Mayo Clinic leadership clearly and accurately ensuring key messages are conveyed; routinely leads client discussions.
Demonstrates effective oral and written communication and presentation skills in providing information to various audiences to facilitate and negotiate issues while simultaneously building credibility and rapport.
Is recognized as and relied upon as a subject matter expert who can recognize problems, formulate solutions and implement change.
May assist Audit Directors in the preparation of Board of Governors / Audit and Compliance Committee leadership materials.
Ad-hoc travel may be required, as work activities warrant (e.g. team on-site meetings and/or training).
Bachelor’s degree in MIS/Computer Science or general business with emphasis in MIS/Computer Science or related field and/or an MBA in lieu of aforementioned fields required. Requires eight years of experience in information technology, which must include five years IT auditing experience. Bachelor's degree from an accredited university in a relevant field of study, with at least seven years of relevant experience.
Public accounting (with regional or Big 4 accounting firm) and/or healthcare experience preferred.
Certification (CPA, CIA, CISA, CISSP or CFE) required. Mayo Clinic is located in the heart of downtown Rochester, Minnesota, a vibrant, friendly city that provides a highly livable environment for more than 34,000 Mayo staff and students. The city is consistently ranked among the best places to live in the United States because of its affordable cost of living, healthy lifestyle, excellent school systems and exceptionally high quality of life.

Who are we?
Michigan Milk Producers Association (MMPA), established in 1916, is a member owned and operated dairy cooperative. MMPA serves approximately 1,600 dairy farmer members in Michigan, Indiana, Wisconsin and Ohio. The dairy cooperative, the 10th largest in the U.S., employs approximately 320 people in four states.
MMPA markets nearly 5 billion pounds of milk annually to fluid milk customers and food ingredient manufacturers. MMPA operates two manufacturing plants in Ovid and Constantine, Michigan and a cheese plant in Middlebury, Indiana. Products made at the Michigan plants include butter, ultra-filtered milk, powdered milk, cream and condensed skim milk. These products are sold to a wide range of food manufacturers who make end-use products such as candy, ice cream, pudding, baked goods, cheese and yogurt.

Job Summary:
Supports all aspects of Company’s IT infrastructure, including communications, office software & hardware, warehouse management systems and related technology & hardware. This position supports a 24/7 logistics operation of a growing company with locations in two port cities. The IT Manager will office out of Savannah, with travel to Charleston as needed and will report to Executive Staff. This is a salaried exempt position and is eligible for medical benefits, paid holidays and vacation, and related benefits.
Responsibilities include:
Implement, support, and maintain all warehouse management and business systems.
Interact and effectively communicate with customers and vendors while effectively satisfying customer demands, in a professional and clear manner.

Manager of Infrastructure team
· Lead the IT Support field group
· Clearly communicate support goals, and issues to all business customers.
· Maintain and create supporting documentation as needed.
· Manage service providers/vendors as needed within IT infrastructure.
· Ensure services levels are met.
· Ensure customer satisfaction in line with the SLAs through ongoing monitoring.
· Research chronic technical issue and develop go-forward planning for continued support.

Who are we?
Michigan Milk Producers Association (MMPA), established in 1916, is a member owned and operated dairy cooperative. MMPA serves approximately 1,600 dairy farmer members in Michigan, Indiana, Wisconsin and Ohio. The dairy cooperative, the 10th largest in the U.S., employs approximately 320 people in four states.
MMPA markets nearly 5 billion pounds of milk annually to fluid milk customers and food ingredient manufacturers. MMPA operates two manufacturing plants in Ovid and Constantine, Michigan and a cheese plant in Middlebury, Indiana. Products made at the Michigan plants include butter, ultra-filtered milk, powdered milk, cream and condensed skim milk. These products are sold to a wide range of food manufacturers who make end-use products such as candy, ice cream, pudding, baked goods, cheese and yogurt.

Mayo Clinic is located in the heart of downtown Rochester, Minnesota, a vibrant, friendly city that provides a highly livable environment for more than 34,000 Mayo staff and students. The city is consistently ranked among the best places to live in the United States because of its affordable cost of living, healthy lifestyle, excellent school systems and exceptionally high quality of life.

Who are we?
Michigan Milk Producers Association (MMPA), established in 1916, is a member owned and operated dairy cooperative. MMPA serves approximately 1,600 dairy farmer members in Michigan, Indiana, Wisconsin and Ohio. The dairy cooperative, the 10th largest in the U.S., employs approximately 320 people in four states.
MMPA markets nearly 5 billion pounds of milk annually to fluid milk customers and food ingredient manufacturers. MMPA operates two manufacturing plants in Ovid and Constantine, Michigan and a cheese plant in Middlebury, Indiana. Products made at the Michigan plants include butter, ultra-filtered milk, powdered milk, cream and condensed skim milk. These products are sold to a wide range of food manufacturers who make end-use products such as candy, ice cream, pudding, baked goods, cheese and yogurt.

Who are we?
Michigan Milk Producers Association (MMPA), established in 1916, is a member owned and operated dairy cooperative. MMPA serves approximately 1,600 dairy farmer members in Michigan, Indiana, Wisconsin and Ohio. The dairy cooperative, the 10th largest in the U.S., employs approximately 320 people in four states.
MMPA markets nearly 5 billion pounds of milk annually to fluid milk customers and food ingredient manufacturers. MMPA operates two manufacturing plants in Ovid and Constantine, Michigan and a cheese plant in Middlebury, Indiana. Products made at the Michigan plants include butter, ultra-filtered milk, powdered milk, cream and condensed skim milk. These products are sold to a wide range of food manufacturers who make end-use products such as candy, ice cream, pudding, baked goods, cheese and yogurt.

Who are we?
Michigan Milk Producers Association (MMPA), established in 1916, is a member owned and operated dairy cooperative. MMPA serves approximately 1,600 dairy farmer members in Michigan, Indiana, Wisconsin and Ohio. The dairy cooperative, the 10th largest in the U.S., employs approximately 320 people in four states.
MMPA markets nearly 5 billion pounds of milk annually to fluid milk customers and food ingredient manufacturers. MMPA operates two manufacturing plants in Ovid and Constantine, Michigan and a cheese plant in Middlebury, Indiana. Products made at the Michigan plants include butter, ultra-filtered milk, powdered milk, cream and condensed skim milk. These products are sold to a wide range of food manufacturers who make end-use products such as candy, ice cream, pudding, baked goods, cheese and yogurt.

The Opportunity:
The responsibilities of an IT Manager’s vary based on a company’s needs, but typically focuses on computer networks. IT Managers determine new hardware and software needs, oversee code requirements and run cables to new work areas. The IT Manager runs tests to verify that the components of the system are functioning at maximum efficiency.
IT Managers build and implement the systems architecture, direct the work of Systems Analysts and Security Analysts. They also manage personnel verifying the completion of their tasks and are involved in their hiring and training. An IT Manager also manages budget activity, updating senior management and maintaining the security of the data and systems round out the manager’s accountabilities.

Who are we?
Michigan Milk Producers Association (MMPA), established in 1916, is a member owned and operated dairy cooperative. MMPA serves approximately 1,600 dairy farmer members in Michigan, Indiana, Wisconsin and Ohio. The dairy cooperative, the 10th largest in the U.S., employs approximately 320 people in four states.
MMPA markets nearly 5 billion pounds of milk annually to fluid milk customers and food ingredient manufacturers. MMPA operates two manufacturing plants in Ovid and Constantine, Michigan and a cheese plant in Middlebury, Indiana. Products made at the Michigan plants include butter, ultra-filtered milk, powdered milk, cream and condensed skim milk. These products are sold to a wide range of food manufacturers who make end-use products such as candy, ice cream, pudding, baked goods, cheese and yogurt.

The Opportunity:
The responsibilities of an IT Manager’s vary based on a company’s needs, but typically focuses on computer networks. IT Managers determine new hardware and software needs, oversee code requirements and run cables to new work areas. The IT Manager runs tests to verify that the components of the system are functioning at maximum efficiency.
IT Managers build and implement the systems architecture, direct the work of Systems Analysts and Security Analysts. They also manage personnel verifying the completion of their tasks and are involved in their hiring and training. An IT Manager also manages budget activity, updating senior management and maintaining the security of the data and systems round out the manager’s accountabilities.
The Company:

BITCO Corporation is currently seeking a Manager, IT Operations Support to join our Home Office team in Davenport, IA. With 13 branch offices in 12 states, BITCO provides quality insurance services to special industries including construction, forest products, and oil & gas.

Position Summary:
The primary responsibilities of the Manager, IT Operations Support is to support the operations and execution of the company's mainframe systems, internal customer support and the security/governance processes. This role utilizes strong communication, organizational, and analytical skills as well as knowledge of best practices to navigate opportunities and challenges related to their areas of responsibility.

Primary Responsibilities:
Directs and supervises the work of Mainframe Support, Helpdesk and Governance teams, including the quality, quantity and timeliness of work to meet goals and milestones.

Who are we?
Michigan Milk Producers Association (MMPA), established in 1916, is a member owned and operated dairy cooperative. MMPA serves approximately 1,600 dairy farmer members in Michigan, Indiana, Wisconsin and Ohio. The dairy cooperative, the 10th largest in the U.S., employs approximately 320 people in four states.
MMPA markets nearly 5 billion pounds of milk annually to fluid milk customers and food ingredient manufacturers. MMPA operates two manufacturing plants in Ovid and Constantine, Michigan and a cheese plant in Middlebury, Indiana. Products made at the Michigan plants include butter, ultra-filtered milk, powdered milk, cream and condensed skim milk. These products are sold to a wide range of food manufacturers who make end-use products such as candy, ice cream, pudding, baked goods, cheese and yogurt.

The Opportunity:
The responsibilities of an IT Manager’s vary based on a company’s needs, but typically focuses on computer networks. IT Managers determine new hardware and software needs, oversee code requirements and run cables to new work areas. The IT Manager runs tests to verify that the components of the system are functioning at maximum efficiency.
IT Managers build and implement the systems architecture, direct the work of Systems Analysts and Security Analysts. They also manage personnel verifying the completion of their tasks and are involved in their hiring and training. An IT Manager also manages budget activity, updating senior management and maintaining the security of the data and systems round out the manager’s accountabilities.

Who are we?
Michigan Milk Producers Association (MMPA), established in 1916, is a member owned and operated dairy cooperative. MMPA serves approximately 1,600 dairy farmer members in Michigan, Indiana, Wisconsin and Ohio. The dairy cooperative, the 10th largest in the U.S., employs approximately 320 people in four states.
MMPA markets nearly 5 billion pounds of milk annually to fluid milk customers and food ingredient manufacturers. MMPA operates two manufacturing plants in Ovid and Constantine, Michigan and a cheese plant in Middlebury, Indiana. Products made at the Michigan plants include butter, ultra-filtered milk, powdered milk, cream and condensed skim milk. These products are sold to a wide range of food manufacturers who make end-use products such as candy, ice cream, pudding, baked goods, cheese and yogurt.

The Opportunity:
The responsibilities of an IT Manager’s vary based on a company’s needs, but typically focuses on computer networks. IT Managers determine new hardware and software needs, oversee code requirements and run cables to new work areas. The IT Manager runs tests to verify that the components of the system are functioning at maximum efficiency.
IT Managers build and implement the systems architecture, direct the work of Systems Analysts and Security Analysts. They also manage personnel verifying the completion of their tasks and are involved in their hiring and training. An IT Manager also manages budget activity, updating senior management and maintaining the security of the data and systems round out the manager’s accountabilities.

Who are we?
Michigan Milk Producers Association (MMPA), established in 1916, is a member owned and operated dairy cooperative. MMPA serves approximately 1,600 dairy farmer members in Michigan, Indiana, Wisconsin and Ohio. The dairy cooperative, the 10th largest in the U.S., employs approximately 320 people in four states.
MMPA markets nearly 5 billion pounds of milk annually to fluid milk customers and food ingredient manufacturers. MMPA operates two manufacturing plants in Ovid and Constantine, Michigan and a cheese plant in Middlebury, Indiana. Products made at the Michigan plants include butter, ultra-filtered milk, powdered milk, cream and condensed skim milk. These products are sold to a wide range of food manufacturers who make end-use products such as candy, ice cream, pudding, baked goods, cheese and yogurt.

What kind of person are we looking for?

So what will I be doing every day?

What are the requirements for this position?



What do I get for all my hard work?


How do I apply?

No phone calls or recruiters please. If you're serious about this job, please tell us "why" you're the person we're looking for. We're looking forward to learning more about you!

Who are we?
Michigan Milk Producers Association (MMPA), established in 1916, is a member owned and operated dairy cooperative. MMPA serves approximately 1,600 dairy farmer members in Michigan, Indiana, Wisconsin and Ohio. The dairy cooperative, the 10th largest in the U.S., employs approximately 320 people in four states.
MMPA markets nearly 5 billion pounds of milk annually to fluid milk customers and food ingredient manufacturers. MMPA operates two manufacturing plants in Ovid and Constantine, Michigan and a cheese plant in Middlebury, Indiana. Products made at the Michigan plants include butter, ultra-filtered milk, powdered milk, cream and condensed skim milk. These products are sold to a wide range of food manufacturers who make end-use products such as candy, ice cream, pudding, baked goods, cheese and yogurt.

The Opportunity:
The responsibilities of an IT Manager’s vary based on a company’s needs, but typically focuses on computer networks. IT Managers determine new hardware and software needs, oversee code requirements and run cables to new work areas. The IT Manager runs tests to verify that the components of the system are functioning at maximum efficiency.
IT Managers build and implement the systems architecture, direct the work of Systems Analysts and Security Analysts. They also manage personnel verifying the completion of their tasks and are involved in their hiring and training. An IT Manager also manages budget activity, updating senior management and maintaining the security of the data and systems round out the manager’s accountabilities.

Who are we?
Michigan Milk Producers Association (MMPA), established in 1916, is a member owned and operated dairy cooperative. MMPA serves approximately 1,600 dairy farmer members in Michigan, Indiana, Wisconsin and Ohio. The dairy cooperative, the 10th largest in the U.S., employs approximately 320 people in four states.
MMPA markets nearly 5 billion pounds of milk annually to fluid milk customers and food ingredient manufacturers. MMPA operates two manufacturing plants in Ovid and Constantine, Michigan and a cheese plant in Middlebury, Indiana. Products made at the Michigan plants include butter, ultra-filtered milk, powdered milk, cream and condensed skim milk. These products are sold to a wide range of food manufacturers who make end-use products such as candy, ice cream, pudding, baked goods, cheese and yogurt.

IT Managers determine new hardware and software needs, oversee code requirements and run cables to new work areas. An IT Manager also manages budget activity, updating senior management and maintaining the security of the data and systems round out the manager’s accountabilities.

Who are we?
Michigan Milk Producers Association (MMPA), established in 1916, is a member owned and operated dairy cooperative. MMPA serves approximately 1,600 dairy farmer members in Michigan, Indiana, Wisconsin and Ohio. The dairy cooperative, the 10th largest in the U.S., employs approximately 320 people in four states.
MMPA markets nearly 5 billion pounds of milk annually to fluid milk customers and food ingredient manufacturers. MMPA operates two manufacturing plants in Ovid and Constantine, Michigan and a cheese plant in Middlebury, Indiana. Products made at the Michigan plants include butter, ultra-filtered milk, powdered milk, cream and condensed skim milk. These products are sold to a wide range of food manufacturers who make end-use products such as candy, ice cream, pudding, baked goods, cheese and yogurt.

Who are we?
Michigan Milk Producers Association (MMPA), established in 1916, is a member owned and operated dairy cooperative. MMPA serves approximately 1,600 dairy farmer members in Michigan, Indiana, Wisconsin and Ohio. The dairy cooperative, the 10th largest in the U.S., employs approximately 320 people in four states.
MMPA markets nearly 5 billion pounds of milk annually to fluid milk customers and food ingredient manufacturers. MMPA operates two manufacturing plants in Ovid and Constantine, Michigan and a cheese plant in Middlebury, Indiana. Products made at the Michigan plants include butter, ultra-filtered milk, powdered milk, cream and condensed skim milk. These products are sold to a wide range of food manufacturers who make end-use products such as candy, ice cream, pudding, baked goods, cheese and yogurt.

The Opportunity:
The responsibilities of an IT Manager’s vary based on a company’s needs, but typically focuses on computer networks. IT Managers determine new hardware and software needs, oversee code requirements and run cables to new work areas. The IT Manager runs tests to verify that the components of the system are functioning at maximum efficiency.
IT Managers build and implement the systems architecture, direct the work of Systems Analysts and Security Analysts. They also manage personnel verifying the completion of their tasks and are involved in their hiring and training. An IT Manager also manages budget activity, updating senior management and maintaining the security of the data and systems round out the manager’s accountabilities.
The Company:

Who are we?
Michigan Milk Producers Association (MMPA), established in 1916, is a member owned and operated dairy cooperative. MMPA serves approximately 1,600 dairy farmer members in Michigan, Indiana, Wisconsin and Ohio. The dairy cooperative, the 10th largest in the U.S., employs approximately 320 people in four states.
MMPA markets nearly 5 billion pounds of milk annually to fluid milk customers and food ingredient manufacturers. MMPA operates two manufacturing plants in Ovid and Constantine, Michigan and a cheese plant in Middlebury, Indiana. Products made at the Michigan plants include butter, ultra-filtered milk, powdered milk, cream and condensed skim milk. These products are sold to a wide range of food manufacturers who make end-use products such as candy, ice cream, pudding, baked goods, cheese and yogurt.

The Opportunity:
The responsibilities of an IT Manager’s vary based on a company’s needs, but typically focuses on computer networks. IT Managers determine new hardware and software needs, oversee code requirements and run cables to new work areas. The IT Manager runs tests to verify that the components of the system are functioning at maximum efficiency.
IT Managers build and implement the systems architecture, direct the work of Systems Analysts and Security Analysts. They also manage personnel verifying the completion of their tasks and are involved in their hiring and training. An IT Manager also manages budget activity, updating senior management and maintaining the security of the data and systems round out the manager’s accountabilities.
The Company:

Leads the Authorities’ Information Technology (IT) department by performing complex professional and administrative work in the planning, development, implementation, and maintenance of information, operational, and telecommunications systems and related information resources operations. Responsible for the management of a team of IT professionals who are responsible for the Authorities’ technology and data systems operations and infrastructure. Manages, maintains, and supervises complex operations that include network security, production operation systems, ERP systems, telecommunications systems and all related hardware. Work is performed under general supervision of the Director of Finance/Administration.
Directs and oversees the Information Technology Department to ensure efficient and effective operations of all Authority functions through secure and up to date technology.

Who are we?
Michigan Milk Producers Association (MMPA), established in 1916, is a member owned and operated dairy cooperative. MMPA serves approximately 1,600 dairy farmer members in Michigan, Indiana, Wisconsin and Ohio. The dairy cooperative, the 10th largest in the U.S., employs approximately 320 people in four states.
MMPA markets nearly 5 billion pounds of milk annually to fluid milk customers and food ingredient manufacturers. MMPA operates two manufacturing plants in Ovid and Constantine, Michigan and a cheese plant in Middlebury, Indiana. Products made at the Michigan plants include butter, ultra-filtered milk, powdered milk, cream and condensed skim milk. These products are sold to a wide range of food manufacturers who make end-use products such as candy, ice cream, pudding, baked goods, cheese and yogurt.

The Opportunity:
The responsibilities of an IT Manager’s vary based on a company’s needs, but typically focuses on computer networks. IT Managers determine new hardware and software needs, oversee code requirements and run cables to new work areas. The IT Manager runs tests to verify that the components of the system are functioning at maximum efficiency.
IT Managers build and implement the systems architecture, direct the work of Systems Analysts and Security Analysts. They also manage personnel verifying the completion of their tasks and are involved in their hiring and training. An IT Manager also manages budget activity, updating senior management and maintaining the security of the data and systems round out the manager’s accountabilities.

Job Title: IT Service Desk Manager- Remote Position in State of WI
Job Description:
Inclusa’s Information Technology Division has completely transformed – we’ve moved over 80% of our assets to the cloud and have modernized our entire end user compute environment. Our customer satisfaction scores are through the roof, we have an amazing partnership with the business, and we’re leading the Company’s digital transformation.
We’re seeking a highly motivated leader to join our team as the IT Service Desk Manager. In this highly visible leadership role, you will be responsible for leading the optimization of our IT Service Desk using ITIL principles to drive process, process automation, problem identification/resolution and more. We’ve done an amazing job supporting our colleagues, but we know we have a lot of opportunity to leverage best practices, innovation, artificial intelligence, automation, data and more to optimize our operations and shifting resources from break-fix to value driving activities.
It doesn’t stop there, in order to truly ensure we deliver an amazing experience you will also be responsible for further modernizing our Windows 10 Enterprise desktop computing environment utilizing Microsoft Intune and Windows Autopilot to provide a world class, modern, secure, stable computing environment that enables our colleagues to achieve their outcomes from their very first day on the team.

Required

In this role, you will analyze our current systems and assets, recommend and implement solutions and upgrades, and provide training. Experience with Windows, Microsoft Office, Microsoft CRM, and SharePoint tools; possess a thorough understanding of the internet and cloud computing including DNS, security, IP routing, http, VPN, email routing, and spam.
A minimum of 3 years proven leadership, mentoring and coaching experience.
Requires relevant certification in information services or ability to obtain within 2yrs of position. Once certified, you must obtain the required continuing education or recertification credits/process.
Must be organized, detail oriented, self-directed, motivated contributor with ability to effective lead a team.

Who are we?
Michigan Milk Producers Association (MMPA), established in 1916, is a member owned and operated dairy cooperative. MMPA serves approximately 1,600 dairy farmer members in Michigan, Indiana, Wisconsin and Ohio. The dairy cooperative, the 10th largest in the U.S., employs approximately 320 people in four states.
MMPA markets nearly 5 billion pounds of milk annually to fluid milk customers and food ingredient manufacturers. MMPA operates two manufacturing plants in Ovid and Constantine, Michigan and a cheese plant in Middlebury, Indiana. Products made at the Michigan plants include butter, ultra-filtered milk, powdered milk, cream and condensed skim milk. These products are sold to a wide range of food manufacturers who make end-use products such as candy, ice cream, pudding, baked goods, cheese and yogurt.

Who are we?
Michigan Milk Producers Association (MMPA), established in 1916, is a member owned and operated dairy cooperative. MMPA serves approximately 1,600 dairy farmer members in Michigan, Indiana, Wisconsin and Ohio. The dairy cooperative, the 10th largest in the U.S., employs approximately 320 people in four states.
MMPA markets nearly 5 billion pounds of milk annually to fluid milk customers and food ingredient manufacturers. MMPA operates two manufacturing plants in Ovid and Constantine, Michigan and a cheese plant in Middlebury, Indiana. Products made at the Michigan plants include butter, ultra-filtered milk, powdered milk, cream and condensed skim milk. These products are sold to a wide range of food manufacturers who make end-use products such as candy, ice cream, pudding, baked goods, cheese and yogurt.

Job Title: IT Service Desk Manager- Remote Position in State of WI
Job Description:
Inclusa’s Information Technology Division has completely transformed – we’ve moved over 80% of our assets to the cloud and have modernized our entire end user compute environment. Our customer satisfaction scores are through the roof, we have an amazing partnership with the business, and we’re leading the Company’s digital transformation.
We’re seeking a highly motivated leader to join our team as the IT Service Desk Manager. In this highly visible leadership role, you will be responsible for leading the optimization of our IT Service Desk using ITIL principles to drive process, process automation, problem identification/resolution and more. We’ve done an amazing job supporting our colleagues, but we know we have a lot of opportunity to leverage best practices, innovation, artificial intelligence, automation, data and more to optimize our operations and shifting resources from break-fix to value driving activities.
It doesn’t stop there, in order to truly ensure we deliver an amazing experience you will also be responsible for further modernizing our Windows 10 Enterprise desktop computing environment utilizing Microsoft Intune and Windows Autopilot to provide a world class, modern, secure, stable computing environment that enables our colleagues to achieve their outcomes from their very first day on the team.

The Position:
In this role, you will analyze our current systems and assets, recommend and implement solutions and upgrades, and provide training. Our ideal candidate has knowledge of system selection, implementation and maintenance. From day one, you’ll have an immediate impact on the day-to-day efficiency of our IT operations, and an ongoing impact on our overall growth.
Objectives of this Role
· Maintain essential IT operations, including operating systems, security tools, applications, servers, email systems, laptops, desktops, software, and hardware
· Own projects, solutions, and key responsibilities within a larger business initiative

QUALIFICATIONS
Requires a combination of education and experience equivalent to 10 years information systems or technology responsibilities.
Experience with Windows, Microsoft Office, Microsoft CRM, and SharePoint tools; possess a thorough understanding of the internet and cloud computing including DNS, security, IP routing, http, VPN, email routing, and spam.
A minimum of 3 years proven leadership, mentoring and coaching experience.
Requires relevant certification in information services or ability to obtain within 2yrs of position. Once certified, you must obtain the required continuing education or recertification credits/process.
Must be organized, detail oriented, self-directed, motivated contributor with ability to effective lead a team.
